name: txt_w/fren
desc:
W/ FREN (Infix Condition): True if the unit shares a tile with this object.
Despite what it might look like, w/fren't doesn't work with letters.

name: txt_lookat
desc:
LOOK AT: As an infix condition, true if this object is on the tile in front of the unit. As a verb, makes the unit face this object at end of turn.
Anti: lookaway

name: txt_lookaway
desc:
LOOK AWAY: As an infix condition, true if this object is on the tile behind the unit As a verb, makes the unit face away from this object at end of turn.
Anti: lookat

name: txt_behind
desc:
BEHIND (Infix Condition): True if an indicated object is looking away from the unit on an adjacent tile.
Anti: seenby

name: txt_beside
desc:
BESIDE (Infix Condition): True if an indicated object is at the side of the unit on an adjacent tile.
Anti: diagonals

name: txt_frenles
desc: FRENLES (Prefix Condition): True if the unit is alone on its tile.

name: txt_arond
desc: AROND (Infix Condition): True if the indicated object is on any of the tiles surrounding the unit. (The unit's own tile is not checked.) ORTHO/DIAG AROND will only check the tiles orthogonally or diagonally. GO^ AROND will only check the tile in that direction.

name: txt_wait...
desc: WAIT... (Prefix Condition): True if the player waited last input. (This does not include clicks.)

name: txt_sans
desc: SANS (Infix Condition): True if none of the indicated object exist in the level. Does not include itself (so BAB SANS BAB is true if there is only one bab in the level).

name: txt_mayb
desc: ? (MAYBE) (Prefix Condition): Has a chance of being true, independent for each MAYBE, affected unit and turn. The number on top indicates the % chance of being true. Compatible with N'T.

name: txt_seenby
desc:
SEEN BY (Infix Condition): True if an indicated object is looking at this unit from an adjacent tile.
Anti: behind

name: txt_lit
desc: LIT (Prefix Condition): A BRITE object emits light in all directions. LIT will be true for objects on the same FLYE level if nothing TRANPARN'T is in the way.

name: txt_an
desc: AN (Prefix Condition): True for a single arbitrary unit per turn and condition. To get multiple results in one tile, rotate the ANs in different directions.

name: txt_reed
desc:
REED: Causes the unit to appear red. Persistent and can be used as a prefix condition.
Anti: cyeann

name: txt_bleu
desc:
BLEU: Causes the unit to appear blue. Persistent and can be used as a prefix condition.
Anti: orang

name: txt_grun
desc:
GRUN: Causes the unit to appear green. Persistent and can be used as a prefix condition.
Anti: pinc

name: txt_yello
desc:
YELLO: Causes the unit to appear yellow. Persistent and can be used as a prefix condition. Reed + Grun.
Anti: purp

name: txt_purp
desc:
PURP: Causes the unit to appear purple. Persistent and can be used as a prefix condition.
Anti: yello

name: txt_orang
desc:
ORANG: Causes the unit to appear orange. Persistent and can be used as a prefix condition.
Anti: bleu

name: txt_cyeann
desc:
CYEANN: Causes the unit to appear cyan. Persistent and can be used as a prefix condition.
Anti: reed

name: txt_whit
desc:
WHIT: Causes the unit to appear white. Persistent and can be used as a prefix condition. Bleu + Yello, Reed + Cyeann, Grun + Purp.
Anti: blacc

name: txt_blacc
desc:
BLACC: Causes the unit to appear black. Persistent and can be used as a prefix condition.
Anti: whit

name: txt_pinc
desc:
PINC: Causes the unit to become pink!
Anti: grun

name: txt_graey
desc:
GRAEY: Causes the unit to become gray/grey.
Color or colour?
Anti: graey

name: txt_brwn
desc:
BRWN: Causes the unit to become brown.
Anti: cyeann

name: txt_corekt
desc: COREKT (Prefix Condition): True if the unit is in an active rule.

name: txt_rong
desc: RONG: As a prefix, true if the unit is in a negated rule (via rong, n't, or notranform). As a property, if a rule has a rong unit in it it'll be negated.

name: txt_the
desc: THE: Refers to the object it's pointing at.

name: txt_that
desc: THAT (Infix Condition): x THAT BE y is true if x BE y. x THAT GOT Y is true if x GOT y. And so on.

name: txt_thatbe
desc: THAT BE (Infix Condition): x THAT BE y is true if x BE y.

name: txt_thatgot
desc: THAT GOT (Infix Condition): x THAT GOT y is true if x GOT y.

name: txt_timles
desc: TIMLES (Prefix Condition): True if ZA WARUDO is active.

name: txt_clikt
desc:
CLIKT (Prefix Condition): CLIKT objects will be true when left-clicked. Clicks will pass a turn if this text exists.
Anti: right click (does not prevent the stack box, though it's made after the move has been made)

name: txt_wun
desc: WUN: A prefix condition that's true if the unit is a won level. If the unit isn't a level, then true if the current level is won.

name: txt_past
desc: PAST (Prefix Condition): Applies the rule to turns that have already happened. (It's about as great as it sounds.)

name: txt_oob
desc: OOB (Prefix Condition): True if the unit is on a border.

name: txt_alt
desc: ALT (Prefix Condition): True every other turn.

name: txt_deez
desc: DEEZ: Refers to the objects in the direction it's pointing at.

name: txt_meow
desc:
Like AROND, but instead of only checking one tile it goes until it hits a TRANPARN'T object, following spatial warping/etc.
Currently has a range cap of 100 because it's laggy.
